not allowed 1there may be special requirements if the land application site is within the boundaries of a wellhead protection area o daily surface application rates of liquid septage on nonfrozen nonsnow covered sites are found in table 4 table 4 soil texture maximum daily application rate gallonsunit per acreday fine sand and loamy sand 25000 sandy loam loam silt or silt loam 15000 sandy clay loam clay loam sandy lay or silty clay loam 10000  print preview  3033 p land application sites shall not be used for crops for direct human consumption unless the waiting period on table 5 is followed table 5 restricted activity waiting period food crops whose harvested part may touch the soilseptage mixture melons squash tomatoes etc 14 months food crops with harvested parts below the surface potatoes carrots etc 38 months feed food or fiber crops that do not touch the soil surface field corn sweet corn hay flax etc 30 days turf harvest 1 year grazing of animals 30 days public access to land  high potential for exposure 1 year  low potential for exposure 30 days  2272012 grease trap wastes land application of grease trap waste or grease trap wastes mixed with nongrease trap septage must follow the most restrictive provision as follows a grease trap waste must be incorporated into the soil within six hours of surface application the application rate shall not exceed 15000 gallons per acre per year b grease trap waste must be injected into the soil and is limited to an application rate of 15000 gallons per acre per year c grease trap waste from a tank designed for the purpose of removing fats oils and greases from effluent before discharge to an ssts must be mixed with domestic septage prior to land application the quantity of grease trap waste mixed with septage cannot exceed 25 percent of the mixture by volume maximum application rates of this mixture are limited to 60000 gallons per acre per year d when no separate grease trap is in place to collect greases fats and oils the septic tank that receives effluent shall be considered the grease trap the grease trap waste from this first septic tank must be combined with domestic septage and mixed prior to land application the quantity of grease trap waste mixed with septage cannot exceed 50 percent of the mixture by volume the source of the septage used for diluting the grease trap waste can be from the other tanks in series with this first tank or from tanks from another ssts maximum application rates of this mixture are limited to 30000 gallons per acre per year  2272012 record keeping and reporting  print preview  3133 in addition to epa recording keeping requirements the maintainer shall develop a record keeping system that provides the information required by this section and retain such records for a minimum of five years the reporting year will run from september 1 of each year of the following year such report shall be submitted to the city no later than november 1 of each year the following information is required to be reported a daily land application activities including 1 each site where septage was applied the date of application permit number for the site and parcel identification number 2 the exact location on the site septage was applied and the number of acres to receive septage 3 the quantity of septage applied 4 the method of application 5 vector attraction reduction and pathogen reduction method used if alkali addition is used records must indicate the ph of each load 6 a description of any additional management practices and site restrictions that were used 7 grease trap waste methods of disposal and incorporation b any other analysis of information as required the department  2272012 article vi enforcement and violations access stop work orders violation civil and other action access no person shall hinder or otherwise interfere with the citys employees in the performance of their duties and responsibilities pursuant to this article  2272012 stop work orders stop work orders may be issued when the city has probable cause to believe that an activity regulated by this or any other city ordinance is being or has been undertaken without a permit or in violation of the provisions of a permit when work has been stopped by a red tag the permit shall be suspended and the work shall not resume until the reason for the work stoppage has been completely satisfied any administrative fees paid the stop work order lifted and the permit reinstated to continue work or resume work is in effect is a violation of this article and a separate violation from the violation which caused the stop work order  2272012 violation any person firm agent corporation or government subdivision that violates any of the provisions of this article shall be guilty of a misdemeanor each day that a violation exists shall constitute a separate offense which may result in a citation  print preview  3233  2272012 civil and other action in the event of a violation or imminent violation of this article the city may in addition to other remedies initiate appropriate civil action or proceedings to prevent prosecute restrain correct or abate such violations or imminent violations the city attorney shall have authority to commence such civil action the city and city attorney may take such actions as may be necessary to enforce the provisions of this article  2272012 article vii costs and reimbursements if the city is required to remove or abate an imminent threat to public health or safety the city may recover all costs incurred in removal or abatement in a civil action including legal fees at the discretion of the city council  2272012 article viii administration fees interpretation variances and appeals severability abrogation and greater restrictions fees the city council shall adopt a fee schedule for activities undertaken by the city pursuant to this article fees shall be due and payable at a time and in a manner to be determined by the city  2272012 interpretation in their interpretation and application the provisions of this article shall be held to be minimum requirements and shall be liberally construed in favor of the city and shall not be deemed a limitation or repeal of any other powers granted by minnesota statutes  2272012 variances and appeals a variance requests an owner may request a variance from the standards specified in this article pursuant to the zoning ordinance article ii division 2 b appeals an owner may make an administrative appeal from a decision made by the city pursuant to the zoning ordinance article ii division 2 c board of adjustment the board of adjustment shall not have the authority to consider variances from technical standards system sizing or vertical separation as specified by minnesota rules chapters 708 708 708 and 7083  2272012 severability  print preview  3333 paragraphs sentences clauses and phrases of this article are severable if any phrase clause sentence paragraph of section of this article shall be declared unconstitutional invalid or unenforceable such unconstitutionality invalidity or unenforceability shall not affect the validity of the remaining phrases clauses sentences paragraphs and sections of this article  2272012 abrogation and greater restrictions it is not intended by this article to repeal abrogate or impair any other existing city ordinance easements covenants or deed restrictions however where this article imposes greater restrictions the provisions of this article shall prevail all other ordinances inconsistent with this article are hereby repealed to the extent of the inconsistency only  2272012  print preview  149 businesses article 18i in general article ii business licenses revocation same  appeal licenses  not transferable no license issued by the city may be transferred from one person to another without permission of the city council  same  revocation any license may be revoked by the city council for a violation of the section or article under which it is issued however the revocation must follow any procedure provided in the section or article in question  same  appeal any person who has made application which has been denied or not acted upon within 30 days after the application may apply directly to the city council for a license the application to the city council shall contain the same information required in the original application plus any additional information that the city council may require or that the applicant may feel is pertinent the city council may grant the license after hearing if the requirements of this substantially complied with and in the opinion of the city council granting of the license would be in the best interest of the public  article iii alcoholic beverages provisions of state law adopted definitions establishment and location of municipal liquor dispensaries municipal liquor dispensaries  manager  responsibilities hours and rules of operations for municipal liquor dispensaries license required types of licenses and fees temporary licenses temporary sunday licenses combination licenses license fees  generally applications for licenses renewal application investigation of applicants and fees  print preview  249 persons ineligible for license places ineligible for a license conditions of license insurance  required liquor license establishments establishments  days and hours revocation suspension and nonrenewal prohibited actions provisions of state law adopted the provisions of minn stats ch 340a are adopted by reference and made part of this article as if fully set out in this article except as modified within this article  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alcoholic beverage means any beverage containing more than onehalf of one percent alcohol by volume distilled spirits means ethyl alcohol hydrated oxide of ethyl spirits of wine whiskey rum brandy gin and other distilled spirits including all dilutions and mixtures thereof for nonindustrial use hotel means any establishment where food and lodging are regularly furnished to transients and which has a a dining room serving the general public at tables and having facilities for seating at least 30 gu at one time  and b guest rooms in the minimum number of 10 intoxicating liquor means any and all ethyl alcohol distilled fermented spirituous vinous and malt beverages containing in excess of 32 percent of alcohol by weight low alcohol malt liquor means any fermented malt beverage containing two percent or less of alcohol by weight notwithstanding any law or rule to the contrary if either a the term low alcohol appears on the label of the beverage container  or b a brewer has provided written certification to the state department of public safety establishing alcoholic content of two percent or less by weight no further label shall be required on that container malt liquor means any beer ale or other beverage made from malt by fermentation and containing not less than onehalf of one percent alcohol by volume manufacturer means every person who by any process of manufacturing fermenting brewing distilling refining rectifying blending or by the combination of different materials prepares or produces intoxicating liquors for sale offsale means the sale of alcoholic beverages in original packages for consumption off the licensed premises where sold only  print preview  349 onsale means the sale of alcoholic beverages for consumption on the licensed premises only restaurant means any establishment other than a hotel under the control of a single proprietor or manager where meals are regularly prepared on the premises and served at tables to the general public such establishment shall have facilities for seating not less than 60 guests at one time sale sell or sold means all barters and all manners or means of furnishing intoxicating or nonintoxicating liquor including such furnishing in violation of any statute ordinance or regulation 32 percent malt liquor means any malt liquor containing not less than onehalf of one percent alcohol by volume nor more than 32 percent alcohol by weight wholesaler means any person who sells alcoholic beverages to persons to whom sale is permitted under minn stats  340a310 from a stock maintained in a warehouse in the state wine means the product made from the normal alcoholic fermentation of grapes including still wine sparkling and carbonated wine wine made from condensed grape must wine made from agricultural products other than sound ripe grapes imitation wine compounds sold as wine vermouth cider perry and sake in each instance containing not less than onehalf of one percent nor more than 24 percent alcohol by volume for nonindustrial use wine does not include distilled spirits as defined in this section  state law reference  definitions minn stats  340a101 establishment and location of municipal liquor dispensaries there is established a municipal dispensary for offsale of intoxicating liquor the dispensaries shall be located at such suitable places as the city council may determine such premises shall be leased or owned by the municipality no premises shall be leased for the operation of a municipal liquor dispensary and no license shall be granted or renewed for premises upon which the taxes or other special levies are delinquent unless by special action of the city council upon good cause shown  state law reference  authority to establish municipal liquor stores minn stats  340a601 municipal liquor dispensaries  manager  responsibilities a immediate charge the dispensary shall be in immediate charge of the manager the manager shall be selected by the city council and shall be paid such compensation as determined by the city council b duties the manager shall have full charge of the operation of such dispensary and have authority to purchase supplies as necessary the manager shall be responsible to the city administrator and the city council c bond at the option of the city administrator or city council the manager andor assistant manager shall furnish a surety bond to the city in such terms as the city council or administrator shall specify conditioned on the faithful discharge of his duties the premiums shall be paid by the city  hours and rules of operations for municipal liquor dispensaries a establish hours the dispensary manager by and with consent of the city administrator shall establish the hours of operation in keeping with state law and efficiency of operation  print preview  449 b conditions of operation no other business other than offsale purchases state lottery associated food and snack purchases and related miscellaneous merchandise such as bar supplies shall be carried on by the dispensary operations or employees loitering shall not be permitted    state law reference  hours of sale minn stats  340a504 license required no person except wholesalers and manufacturers to the extent authorized by law and except the municipal liquor dispensaries shall directly or indirectly deal in sell or offer for sale any alcoholic beverage within the city  nor directly or indirectly in any private club or public place or upon any pretense or by any device allow the consumption or display of intoxicating liquor for the purpose of mixing with intoxicating liquor except as provided in this article without first having received a license and paid a fee as provided in this article  types of licenses and fees in accordance with state law and city ordinances the following types of license fee shall be paid in full before the application for a license is accepted all fees shall be paid into the general fund of the city upon rejection of any application for a license or upon withdrawal of the application for a license before approval by the city council the fee shall be refunded to the applicant less any costs for processing b when the license is for premises where the building is not ready for occupancy the time fixed for computation of the license fee for the initial license period shall be 90 days after approval of the license by the city council or upon the date the building is ready for occupancy whichever is sooner c when an application is received for a license outside of the normal application cycle a pro rata share shall be charged if the remaining period is less than nine months d no part of the fee paid for any license issued under this article shall be refunded except in the following instances upon application to the city council within 30 days from the happening of the conditions described below the city council may refund a pro rata portion of the fee for the unexpired period of a license in excess of 25 percent refunded fee shall be computed on a monthly basis when the operation of the business closes because of 1 destruction or damage of the licensed premises by fire or other catastrophe 2 the licensees death   print preview the owner or any of its members was ever convicted of a crime relating to the sale of intoxicating or nonintoxicating beverages  and if so the nature thereof  e whether or not the applicant has ever applied for or held in other communities a license to sell or permit the consumption on its premises of beer or intoxicating liquor and if a license has been revoked by another community the reason therefor  f fee as set by city council  g whether or not all real estate special assessments personal property taxes for the premises to be licensed which are due and payable have been paid and if not paid the years and amounts which are unpaid  h seating capacity of the structure both in actual seats and building limitations as defined under the uniform building code  i investigation fee for original applications  j application shall be executed as follows if the application is by a natural person it shall be signed and sworn to by such person if by a corporation by an officer thereof and if by a partnership by one of the partners if the application is by an unincorporated association it shall be signed and sworn to by the manager or managing officer thereof if the applicant is a partnership the application license bond and insurance policy shall be made and issued in the name of all partners  k certificate of insurance for coverage as provided in section 1863 it is unlawful to make any false or misleading statements in an application all applications shall be made to the city administrator  state law reference  licenses minn stats  340a401340a414 renewal application applications for the renewal of an existing license shall be made at least 60 days prior to the date of the expiration of the license and shall be made in such abbreviated form as the city council may approve if in the judgment of the city council good and sufficient cause is shown by an applicant for his failure to file for a renewal within the time provided the city council may if the other provisions of this article are complied with grant the application  investigation of applicants and fees a the city administrator shall cause to investigate all facts set out in the application including a consideration of the building with regard to building and zoning codes and proximity to schools and churches a hearing regarding the granting or denial of an application shall be considered upon written request for such stating the reasons for or against such application after such investigation  print preview  749 and hearing a written recommendation shall be made to city council the city council may order or conduct such additional investigation as it deems appropriate the city council shall grant or deny the license in accordance with state law and the provisions of this article b the fee for such investigation shall be set by city council the investigation fee for 32 percent malt liquor on sale licenses for temporary licenses as defined under section 1860 shall be waived investigation fees are not refundable  persons ineligible for license persons ineligible for licenses are as follows a persons under 21 years of age  b persons who have been convicted of a felony or of violating the national prohibition act or any law of this state or local ordinance relating to the manufacture or transportation of intoxicating liquors who within five years of the license application have been convicted of a felony or a willful violation of a federal or state law or local ordinance governing the manufacture sale distribution or possession for sale or distribution of an alcoholic beverage  c persons who have a direct or indirect interest in a manufacturer brewer or wholesaler  d persons who if a corporation does not have a manager who is eligible pursuant to the provisions of this section  e persons who are the spouse of a person ineligible for a license pursuant to the provisions of this section or who in the judgment of the city council are not the real party in interest of beneficial owner of the business operated or to be operated under the license  f persons who already own or has a direct or indirect interest in a license provided for in this article  provided however that this subsection shall not apply to temporary nonintoxicating malt liquor licenses or offsale nonintoxicating licenses  g persons not of good moral character and repute  state law reference  persons eligible minn stats  340a402 places ineligible for a license a no license shall be granted or renewed for operation on any premises on which taxes assessments or other financial claims of the city or of the state are due delinquent or unpaid unless an action pursuant to minn stats ch 278 is pending b no license shall be granted for the sale of alcoholic beverages on any premises where a licensee has been convicted of a violation of this article or applicable state statutes or where any license hereunder has been revoked for cause until six months have elapsed after such conviction or revocation  conditions of license a every license shall be granted subject to the conditions of this article this state law b all licensed premises shall have the licenses posted in a conspicuous place at all times  print preview  849 c no gambling or gambling device shall be permitted on any licensed premises except as authorized under state law d any police officer chief building official or any other employee so designated by the city administrator shall have the unqualified right to enter inspect and search the premises of the license during normal business hours without a warrant e every licensee shall be responsible for the conduct of his place of business and the conditions of sobriety and order in the place of business and on the premises f all sales shall be made in full view of the public g no alcoholic beverage shall be sold or furnished or delivered to any obviously intoxicated person habitual drunkard person under the age of 21 years or to any person to whom sale is prohibited by state law nor shall any of the above persons be allowed to consume alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises h each license shall be issued to the applicant only and shall not be transferable to another holder each license shall be issued only for the premises described in the application no license may be transferred to another place without the approval of the city council i it shall be the duty of each licensee to notify the city administrator of any change in legal ownership or beneficial interest in such licensee any change of beneficial interest in stock entitled to vote which results in a change in voting control of the licensee shall be deemed equivalent to transfer of the license to such corporation and any such license shall be revoked 30 days after any such change of ownership or beneficial interest of shares unless the city council shall have been notified of such change in writing and shall have approved the change if a question arises as to compliance with this subsection the stock transfer record and minute book of any corporate licensee shall be available for inspection by the city administrator or other duly authorized representative of the city at all reasonable times j no licensee shall knowingly permit the licensed premises or any room in those premises or any adjoining building directly or indirectly under his control to be used as a resort for prostitutes or other disorderly persons k the holder of an onsale license for the sale of intoxicating liquor or 32 percent malt liquor shall maintain a current list of all employees of the licensee such list shall be maintained by the licensee within the licensed premises in such place as to be immediately accessible to any peace officer upon demand the peace officer shall be entitled to demand the list whenever he is engaged in the investigation of a possible violation of the provisions of this article the failure of any licensee to maintain such list or to produce such list to a peace officer upon appropriate demand shall be subject to disciplinary action by the city council including the suspension or revocation of the license issued under this article  insurance  required a every person licensed to sell retail intoxicating liquor or 32 percent malt liquor at onsale shall demonstrate proof of liability insurance as a condition of his license b an exception is provided under state law for establishments with onsale wine licenses and 32 percent malt liquor licenses with total gross sales of less than $2500000 for the preceding year documentation showing annual gross sales and a notarized statement certifying to the correctness of such documentation is required the statement does not release owners of liability under the minnesota dram shop act minn stats  340a801  print preview  949 c the liability insurance shall provide for coverage as follows 1 fifty thousand dollars bodily injury coverage for one person $10000000 coverage for more than one person and in the amount of $1000000 because of injury to or destruction of property of others in any one occurrence  2 one hundred thousand dollars for loss of means of support of any one person in any one occurrence and subject to the limit for one person for loss of means of support of two or more persons in any one occurrence d such liability insurance policy shall further provide that no cancellation for any cause except for nonpayment of premium by either the insured or the insurer unless the canceling party has first given 30 days notice in writing to the issuing authority of intent to cancel the policy  and nonpayment of premium unless the canceling party has first given ten days notice in writing to the city administrator of intent to cancel the policy further it shall provide that no payment of any claim by the insurance company shall in any manner decrease the coverage provided for in respect to any other claim or claims brought against the insured or company thereafter such policy shall be conditioned that the insurer shall pay to the extent of the principal amount of the policy any damages for death or injury caused by or resulting from the violation of any law relating to the business for which such license has been granted the licensee and the city shall be named as joint insured on the liability insurance policy e in lieu of providing an insurance policy with the coverage aforesaid the applicant may provide a bond of a surety company or a certificate of the state commissioner of finance that the applicant has deposited cash or securities which may legally be purchased by savings banks or for trust funds having a market value of $10000000 all in the amount of the coverage set forth above as authorized by dishwashing services in an establishment defined in minn stats  340a101 as a restaurant or a hotel or a motel serving food in rooms in which intoxicating or 32 percent malt liquors are sold at retail on sale b minimum seating capacity 1 to be eligible for an intoxicating liquor license onsale any restaurant or the dining area of any hotel or motel must have a minimum seating capacity of 60 persons 2 to be eligible for a wine license onsale any restaurant must have a minimum seating capacity of 30 persons c health safety regulations all establishments licensed under this article shall meet all requirements of state county and local regulations pertaining to health and safety  establishments  days and hours a closing except as otherwise provided in this article all onsale establishments bottle clubs and public drinking places shall be closed to the public not later than onehalf hour after the required time for stopping sales until the time provided in this article as permissible for sales consumption or  print preview  1049 display no persons other than employees shall be permitted within such establishments during the closed periods all such onsale licensees may keep licensed premises open at times when the sale of intoxicating and 32 percent malt liquor is prohibited for sale of food or recreational activity provided such licensee shall lock or in another manner secure all facilities or equipment for the serving of such liquor starting not later than  am sunday without a permit from the state of minnesota alcohol and gambling division or  am on friday if the licensee obtains a permit from the state of minnesota alcohol and gambling division until the time provided in this article as permissible for sales consumption or display all public entrances to premises open after  am shall remain open and unlocked during all times when said premises have customers therein no licensee who elects to remain open after  am shall permit any person to consume or display any liquor in any container including glasses in the premises after  am or  am on friday and saturday with a permit from the state of minnesota alcohol and gambling division and until the time in this article provided as permissible for sales consumption or display b intoxicating liquor establishments no licensee nor other person shall sell consume or display or allow the sale consumption and  am monday inclusive with a permit from the state of minnesota alcohol and gambling division no licensee nor other person shall sell consume or display or allow the sale consumption or display of stats  304a504 revocation suspension and nonrenewal a the city council may suspend or revoke any license for the sale of intoxicating liquor for the violation of any provision or condition of this article or of any state law or federal law regulating the sale of intoxicating liquor or the violation of any provision or condition of this article or of any state law or federal law regulating the sale of intoxicating liquor and shall revoke such license for any willful violation which under the laws of the state is grounds for mandatory revocation and shall revoke for failure to keep the insurance required by this article in full force and effect b except in the case of a suspension pending a hearing on revocation suspension by the city council shall be preceded by written notice to the licensee and a public hearing no suspension or revocation takes effect until the license or permit holder has been given an opportunity for a hearing under minn stats  1457 1469 of the administrative procedure act this section does not require the city to conduct the hearing before an employee of the state office of administrative hearings the city council may without any notice suspend any license pending a hearing on revocation for a period not exceeding 30 days the notice may be served upon the licensee personally or by leaving the same at the licensed premises with the person in charge thereof  print preview  1149  state law reference  license revocation or suspension minn stats  340a415 prohibited actions a it is unlawful for any licensee to employ or to encourage or permit upon or within the licensed premises 1 any person who is unclothed or whose clothing exposes to view any portion of the female breast below the top of the areola  any pubic hair  or the anus vulva or genitals  2 films still pictures electronic reproductions or other visual reproductions exposing those parts of the body prohibited in subsection a1 b a violation of this section shall constitute grounds for the revocation or the suspension of the license irregardless of the charging conviction or acquittal of the licensee the city council shall consider the nature of the violation  the circumstances under which the violation occurred  whether the violation was beyond the control of the licensee  whether the licensee timely took control of and stopped the violation  and prior violations if any of the licensee  article iv bingo gambling devices and raffles purpose definitions license required license applications suspension and revocation appointment of gambling manager conduct of bingo conduct of bingo operation of gambling devices generally filing requirements for bingo license inspection and investigation of records use of receipts use of profits exemptions purpose the purpose of this article is to closely regulate and control the conduct of the game of bingo gambling devices and raffles and to prohibit commercialization  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning  print preview  1249 active member means a member who has paid all dues to the organization who is 18 years of age or older who has equal voting rights with all other members who has equal opportunity to be an elected officer who has equal right and responsibilities of attendance at the regularly scheduled meetings of the organization whose name and membership origination date appear with the members knowledge and consent on a list of members of the organization and who has been a member of the organization for at least six months affiliate means any person or entity directly or indirectly controlling controlled by or under common control or ownership with a licensee of the state gambling control board or any officer or director of a licensee of the state gambling control board allowable expense means the percentage of the total cost incurred by the organization in the purchase of any good service or other item which corresponds to the proportion of the total actual use of the good service or other item that is directly related to conduct of lawful gambling allowable expense includes the advertising of the conduct of lawful gambling provided that the amount expended does not exceed five percent of the annual gross profits of the organization or $500000 per year per organization whichever is less the state gambling control board may adopt rules to regulate the content of the advertising to ensure that the content is consistent with the public welfare bar operation means a method of selling and redeeming gambling equipment within a leased premises which is licensed for the onsale of alcoholic beverages where such sales and redemptions are made by an employee of the lessor from a common area where food and beverages are also sold bingo means a game where each player has a bingo hard card or bingo paper sheet for which a consideration has been paid and played in accordance with this article and with rules of the state gambling control board for the conduct of bingo bingo also includes a linked bingo game bingo occasion means a single gathering or session at which a series of one or more successive bingo games is played eligible organization means any fraternal religious veterans or other nonprofit organization covered by minn stats  29005 subd l clause i or k which organization has been in existence for at least three years and has at least 30 active members gambling equipment means bingo hard cards or paper sheets linked bingo paper sheets devices for selecting bingo numbers pulltabs jar tickets paddlewheels paddlewheel tables paddle tickets paddle ticket cards tipboards tipboard tickets and pulltab dispensing devices paddlewheel means a wheel marked off into sections containing one or more numbers and which after being turned or spun uses a pointer or marker to indicate winning chances profit means the gross receipts collected from one or more bingo occasions or the operation of gambling devices or the conduct of raffles less reasonable sums necessary and actually expended for supplies and equipment prizes rent and city license fees raffle means a game in which a participant buys a ticket for a chance at a prize with the winner determined by a random drawing to take place at a location and date printed upon the ticket tipboard means a board placard or other device in which each section contains a hidden number of numbers or other symbol which determines the winning chances  state law reference  definitions minn stats  34912 license required  print preview  1349 a no bingo occasion may be conducted raffle held or gambling device used except by an eligible organization which has secured a license for that purpose as provided in this article separate licenses shall be required for raffles bingo and gambling devices b no license under this article shall be issued until at least 30 days after the date of application and shall be deemed granted if not denied within 180 days from the date of the application c no license issued may be transferred to any other person or organization no license shall be transferred to any location other than the location specified in the license without prior approval by the city council  state law reference  license required minn stats   license applications every application for a license shall be made to the city administrator on a form supplied by the city and containing such information as the city administrator or city council may require no person shall make a false statement in an application copies of each application shall be referred to the citys chief law enforcement officer fire chief building inspector and other necessary staff persons for their recommendations  state law reference  license application minn stats   suspension and revocation the city council may suspend or revoke any license for a violation of any provision of minn stats ch 349 or this article no license shall be suspended or revoked until an opportunity for a hearing has been granted upon notice personally served or delivered by certified mail at least ten days prior to the hearing which notice shall state the time and place of the hearing and the nature of the charges against the licensee  state law reference  denial suspension revocation of license minn stats   subd 4 appointment of gambling manager a all lawful gambling conducted by a licensed organization must be under the supervision of a gambling manager a gambling manager designated by an organization to supervise lawful gambling is responsible for the gross receipts of the organization and for its conduct in compliance with all laws and rules a person designated as a gambling manager shall maintain a fidelity bond in the sum of $1000000 in favor of the organization conditioned on the faithful performance of the managers duties the terms of the bond must provide that notice be given to the state gambling control board in writing not less than 30 days before its cancellation b a person may not act as a gambling manager for more than one organization c an organization may not conduct lawful gambling without having a gambling manager d an organization may not have more than one gambling manager at any time  state law reference  gambling manager required minn stats   conduct of bingo  print preview  1449 a bingo occasions not more than ten bingo occasions each week may be conducted by an organization at least 15 bingo games must be held at each occasion and a bingo occasion must continue for at least 1 hours but not more than four consecutive hours b bingo during any bingo occasion conducted by an organization the organization is directly responsible for the 1 staffing of the bingo occasion  2 conducting of lawful gambling during the bingo occasion  3 acquiring storage inventory control and reporting of all gambling equipment used by the organization  4 receipt accounting and all expenditures of gross receipts from lawful gambling  and 5 preparation of the bingo packets c winners each bingo winner must be determined and every prize shall be awarded and delivered the same day on which the bingo occasion is conducted except that prizes won in a linked bingo game must be delivered within three business days of the day on which the occasion was conducted d checkers one or more checkers must be engaged for each bingo occasion when bingo is conducted using bingo hard cards the checker or checkers must record on a form the state gambling control board provides the number of hard cards played in each game and the prizes awarded to recorded hard cards the form must provide for the inclusion of the face number of each winning hard card and must include a checkers certification that the figures recorded are correct to the best of the checkers knowledge e bingo cards and sheets 1 the state gambling control board shall by rule require that all licensed organizations a conduct bingo only using liquid daubers on bingo paper sheets that bear an individual number recorded by the distributor  and b use each bingo paper sheet for no more than one bingo occasion in lieu of the requirements of subsection e1 b a licensed organization may electronically record the sale of each bingo hard card or paper sheet at each bingo occasion using an electronic recording system approved by the state gambling control board 2 the requirements of subsection e1 shall only apply to a licensed organization that received gross receipts from bingo in excess of $15000000 in the organizations last fiscal year f conduct of bingo 1 each bingo hard card and paper sheets must have five horizontal rows of spaces with each row except one having five numbers the center row must have four numbers and the center space marked free each column must have one of the letters bingo in order at the top bingo paper sheets may also have numbers that are not preprinted but are filled in by players 2 a game of bingo begins with the first letter and number called each player must cover or mark with a liquid dauber the numbers when bingo balls similarly numbered are randomly drawn announced and displayed to the players either manually or with a flashboard and monitor the game is won when a player has covered or marked a previously designated arrangement of numbers on the card or sheet and declared bingo the game is completed when a winning card or sheet is verified and a prize awarded except that prizes won in linked bingo games may be awarded pursuant to subsection c  print preview  1549 g linked bingo games a licensed organization may conduct or participate in a linked bingo game in association with one or more other licensed organizations h contribution to each prize awarded each participating licensed organization shall contribute to each prize awarded in a linked bingo game in an amount not to exceed $30000 per occasion i adoption of rules the state gambling control board may adopt rules to 1 specify the manner in which a linked bingo game must be played and how the linked bingo prizes must be awarded  2 specify the records to be maintained by a linked bingo game provider  3 require the submission of periodic reports by the linked bingo game provider and specify the content of the reports  4 establish the qualifications required to be licensed as a linked bingo game provider  and 5 any other matter involving the operation of a linked bingo game  state law reference  similar provisions minn stats  34917 conduct of bingo raffle tickets at a minimum must list the three most expensive prizes to be awarded if additional prizes will be awarded that are not contained on the raffle ticket the raffle ticket must contain the statement a complete list of additional prizes is available upon request notwithstanding minn stats  34912 subd 33 raffles conducted under the exemptions in minn stats   may use tickets that contain only the sequential number of the raffle ticket and no other information if the organization makes a list of prizes and a statement of other relevant information required by rule available to persons purchasing tickets and if tickets are only sold at the event and on the date when the tickets are drawn  state law reference  conduct of raffles minn stats   operation of gambling devices generally a no compensation shall be paid to any person in connection with the operation of a gambling device or the conduct of a raffle by a licensed organization no person who is not an active member of an organization or its auxiliary or the spouse or surviving spouse of an active member may participate in the organizations operation of a gambling device or conduct of a raffle b each organization licensed to operate gambling devices shall keep records of its gross receipts expenses and profits for each single gathering or occasion at which gambling devices are operated or a raffle is conducted all deductions from gross receipts for each single gathering or occasion shall be documented with receipts or other records indicating the amount a description of the purchased item or service or other reason for the deduction and the recipient the distribution of profits shall be itemized as to payee purpose amount and date of payment c gross receipts from the operation of gambling devices and the conduct of raffles shall be segregated from other revenues of the organization including bingo gross receipts and placed in a separate account each organization shall have separate records of its gambling operations the person who accounts for gross receipts expenses and profits from the operation of gambling devices or the conduct of raffles shall not be the same person who accounts for other revenues of the organization except that such person may be the same person who accounts for bingo gross receipts expenses and profits  print preview  1649 d each organization licensed to operate gambling devices or to conduct raffles shall report monthly to its membership and to the city its gross receipts expenses and profits from gambling devices or raffles and the itemized distribution of profits e records required by this section shall be preserved for three years and organizations shall make available their records relating to operation of gambling devices and the conduct of raffles for public inspection at reasonable times and places f gambling devices shall be operated and raffles conducted by a licensed organization only upon premises which it owns or leases except that tickets for raffles conducted in accordance with this section may be sold off the premises leases shall be for a period of not less than one year and shall be in writing the leases shall be for one location for the entire licensed year unless otherwise authorized by the city no license shall provide that rental payments shall be based on a percentage of the receipts or profits from gambling devices or raffles copies of all leases shall be provided to the city g total prize from the operation of paddlewheels and tipboards awarded in any single day in which they are operated shall not exceed $50000 total prizes resulting from any single spin of a paddlewheel or from any single tipboard shall not exceed $10000 total prizes awarded in any calendar year by any organization from the operation of paddlewheels and tipboards and the conduct of raffles shall not exceed $1500000 merchandise prizes shall be valued at fair market retail value h nothing in this article shall be construed to authorize any use possession or operation of 1 any gambling device which is activated by the insertion of a coin or token  or 2 any gambling game or device in which the winning numbers tickets or chances are in any way determined by the outcome of any athletic contest or sporting event  state law reference
