public rights of way definitions permit required applications for permit  fee and damage deposit excavators license  surety bond  required suspension or revocation of license time of excavation provisions to excavate failure to secure required permit notification or inspection restoration  excavator responsible minimum standards for restoration findings purpose and intent to provide for the health safety and welfare of its citizens and to ensure the integrity of its streets and the appropriate use of the rightsofway the city strives to keep its rightsofway in a state of good repair and free from unnecessary encumbrances accordingly the city hereby enacts this new chapter of this code relating to rightofway permits and administration this chapter imposes reasonable regulation on the placement and maintenance of facilities and equipment currently within its rightsofway or to be placed therein at some future time it is intended to complement the regulatory roles of state and federal agencies under this chapter persons excavating and obstructing the rightsofway will bear financial responsibility for their work finally this chapter provides for recovery of outof pocket and projected costs from persons using the public rightsof way this chapter shall be interpreted consistently with 1997 session laws substantially codified in minn stat 23716   23779 23781 and  the act and 2017 session laws amending the act and the other laws governing applicable rights of the city and users of the rightofway this chapter shall also be interpreted consistent with minnesota rules    and minnesota rules where possible to the extent any provision of this chapter cannot be interpreted consistently with the minnesota rules that interpretation most consistent with the act and other applicable statutory and case law is intended this chapter shall not be interpreted to limit the regulatory and police powers of the city to adopt and enforce general ordinances necessary to protect the health safety and welfare of the public to the extent that a franchise agreement is in full force and effect whereby the city and an applicant are the parties thereto to the extent that the terms and conditions of this with the terms and conditions of the franchise agreement the terms and conditions of the franchise agreement shall control history adopted by on  election to manage the public rights of way  print preview  522 pursuant to the authority granted to the city under state and federal statutory administrative and common law the city hereby elects pursuant minn stat  subd 2b to manage rightsofway within its jurisdiction history adopted by on  definitions the following definitions apply in this chapter of this code references hereafter to or sections are unless otherwise specified references to sections in this chapter defined terms remain defined terms whether or not capitalized abandoned facility a facility no longer in service or physically disconnected from a portion of the operating facility or from any other facility that is in use or still carries service a facility is not abandoned unless declared so by the rightofway user sadfa sdf dsf asdfasdf asdf sdf sadfasdfasd fd history adopted by on  permit required no person or entity with or without a franchise shall make any excavation in any public street alley way or property without first having secured a permit therefor from the city administrator upon forms supplied by the city  applications for permit  fee and damage deposit a applications for an excavation permit shall be made by the owner or authorized agent and the party employed to do the work the application shall state the location name of the owner street number of the adjoining property and the reason for the excavation b the contractor doing the actual work shall be responsible for the acquisition of the excavation permit the excavation permit fee is set by city council c the permit application must be accompanied by a $100000 damage deposit in the form of cash or letter of credit upon satisfactory restoration and inspection by the public works director in accordance with sections 5063 and 5064 the deposit will be returned to the contractor    12122011 excavators license  surety bond  required a no person shall be granted an excavators license until the city is furnished with a $500000 surety bond made to the city and a certificate of insurance carrying liability and workers compensation coverage conditioned that the licensee will indemnify and save harmless the city from all suits accidents and damage that may arise by reason of any opening in any street alley public way or property b the license fee for an excavators license is set by city council and it runs on a calendar basis expiring on december 31 of each year the licensing of sewer contractors within the city is sufficient to meet the requirements of an excavators license   print preview  622 suspension or revocation of license the city council may suspend or revoke any license issued under this article for any of the following causes a giving false information in connection with the application for the license  b incompetence of the licensee  c willful violation of any provisions of this article or any rule or regulation pertaining to excavations  d failure to reimburse the city for its expenses from any previous claim  time of excavation a excavations on public street alleyway or property must be undertaken monday between the hours of  am and  pm any work accomplished outside of this schedule will require a fee for the entire cost of a public works employee to inspect the process it is the responsibility of the contractor doing the work to notify the city at least 24 hours in advance of any excavation b an exception to the notice required above and the penalty imposed in section 5062 of this article would be authorized in the event notification is given the public works superintendent utility superintendent or authorized representative thereof in a case of a bona fide emergency this emergency would be defined as breakage in any public utility including natural gas and telephone which requires immediate action to correct and which protects the public health safety or welfare a permit will still need to be obtained but it will be accomplished after the fact  provisions to excavate no person or entity will excavate in any street alley public way or property unless a twentyfour hour notice is given the city prior to any digging so that inspection or other needs can be arranged failure to give proper notice will result in a $5000 penalty fee to the contractor doing the work  b a copy of the completed and approved excavation permit is available at the job site for inspection of the public works department personnel inspection  c if the excavation so limits the total use of a public way it is the duty and responsibility of the excavator to install barricades to bar entrance to the excavation area andor redirect traffic if the excavation site has to remain open during dark hours it is the responsibility of the contractor doing the work to provide all the barricades excavation area and material piles with illuminated warning lights  failure to secure required permit notification or inspection any failure to secure a permit prior to digging giving proper notification for excavation or restoration or operating without inspection will be the responsibility of the contractor doing the actual work including penalties andor legal action a penalty will be imposed on the contractor as follows  print preview  722 a failure to give 24hour notice to the city requires a $5000 additional fee  b a fee of double the fee amount will be charged all contractors who operate without an excavation permit  c a fee of double the fee amount will be charged for an excavator who operates without excavators license  d a fee of $10000 will be charged any individual who operates without city inspection  e all penalty fees are subject to revisions by resolution of the city council  restoration  excavator responsible a the excavator shall be responsible for the restoration of the public street alley way or property restoration of a paved area shall require 24hour notice to the public works superintendent or authorized agent thereof b inspection of the restoration process will be required for all paved restorations all pavement restorations will be undertaken monday between the hours of  am and  pm any work accomplished outside of this schedule will require a fee for the entire cost of a public works employee to inspect the process  minimum standards for restoration a the restoration shall be to a minimum standard of six inches of class five and three inches of asphalt or equal to the specifications of the original installation whichever is greater in addition the hole needs to be straightedge cut and repaired with tacked edges compaction of the hole is the responsibility of the excavator if a hole slumps greater than one inch within one years time it is his responsibility to correct the problem b in areas of public ways that are not paved it shall be the responsibility of the excavator to see that all areas are seeded and grass must grow for a period of one month  article iv street and sidewalk use regulations throwing of refuse upon public ways prohibited sales on public way prohibited  exceptions sale possession or consumption of intoxicating beverages  prohibited on public ways skateboarding or similar activity prohibited  exceptions throwing of refuse upon public ways prohibited no person shall throw or deposit any glass metal garbage or other refuse upon any public way  sales on public way prohibited  exceptions no person shall buy sell barter or offer to buy or sell or barter for any goods wares merchandise or service or otherwise engage in any type of business on any public sidewalk or street within the city this section shall not apply when the activities prohibited in this article are expressly permitted in a defined area for a specified period of time by proclamation of the city council  print preview  822  sale possession or consumption of intoxicating beverages  prohibited on public ways a it is unlawful for any person to possess consume sell or otherwise provide to others any intoxicating beverage upon any public way within the city without first obtaining a permit therefor from the city council b it is also unlawful for any person to possess consume or otherwise provide to others any controlled substance upon any public way within the city  skateboarding or similar activity prohibited  exceptions no person shall use a skateboard or engage in similar actions upon a any private or public land in the business district at any time unless so designated as a skateboard or similar activity area by signs authorized by the city council the business district is to include all properties zoned cbd b2 and b3 b any private or public land where a sign has been erected not permitting skateboarding or similar activity c similar activity is the use of a skateboard roller skate roller blade scooter or similar equipment not the use of a bicycle d a person cited or warned by a police officer in violation of the provisions of this section does by his use of the public sidewalks streets and public parking lots consent to the impoundment by a police officer of the inline skates roller skates or skateboard for a period of three days upon first offense a week upon second offense and indefinitely on a third offense  article v parks playground and public grounds application hours of use for parks playgrounds and public grounds uses prohibited violation  penalty application this article shall apply to all parks playgrounds and public grounds owned by or otherwise under the control of the city council within the municipal boundaries of the city irrespective of whether or not any such lands are open to the unsolicited use thereof by city residents or other persons  hours of use for parks playgrounds and public grounds unless otherwise posted no person shall be present in or located upon any park playground or other public ground including parking areas appurtenant thereto between the hours of  pm and  am without the express approval of the city council  provided that this section shall not apply to persons who without delay are traveling parks playgrounds or public grounds upon established walks paths and streets  print preview  922 this section shall also not apply to sporting activities that are clearing the site and leaving the facilities it does not allow the activity itself to continue past  pm    7142008 uses prohibited a no person not an employee of the city shall pick or cut any wild or cultivated flower or cut break or in any way injure or deface any tree shrub or plant or otherwise disturb or disrupt the soil or grounds of such public areas b no person except employees of the city shall plant any wild cultivated or exotic tree shrub or plant without the permission of the city c no person shall kill pursue injure molest disturb or have in possession any species of wildlife including birds waterfowl or other animals found within the confines of the park d no person shall rob disturb or molest the nest eggs or young of any birds or other animals found within the park e no person shall operate a motorized vehicle in any city park or trail except on designated roadways and parking lots unless prior approval is obtained from the city f no person shall start any fire in any such public area except for small fires and charcoal heating for culinary purposes in the cooking devices designed for such use as located in such public areas or in such devices as are brought into such public areas expressly designed and safely located for such purposes no person who starts or otherwise uses any charcoal fire or other fire shall leave such fire until same has been completely extinguished no person starting or using a charcoal fire or other fire shall dispose of the ashes or coals in any place in any public area other than a receptacle provided for refuse and then only after such ashes or coals are sufficiently cold to prevent damage to the receptacles or contents thereof g the city may at its discretion prohibit fires for limited periods at any park location for the continued protection of park property resources and the city h no person shall tamper with climb deface destroy disturb damage or remove any part of any park building sign light table grill shelter equipment or other property found therein i no person shall disregard or fail to comply with any posted regulations directional signs barriers or other control devices located within any city park j no person shall swim or bathe in any water in or adjacent to any city park k no person shall deposit allow to accumulate or dispose of any inorganic waste in or upon a stated public area except to place same in garbage receptacles provided therefor l no person shall engage in boisterous disruptive behavior or excessively loud music or noise within or upon any stated public area or otherwise conduct himself so as to unreasonably disturb or aggravate another person or persons m no person shall erect or place in any or upon any stated public area a tent camping equipment or other temporarily located structure nor shall any person leave any vehicle or movable structure which could be used for the purpose of overnight camping unless prior approval obtained from the city no staking is allowed of said structures without written approval from the city n no person shall place or erect any sign or advertisement on any park land trees structures or equipment located therein unless permission is granted by the city  print preview  1022 o no person shall be permitted to take any dog or cat into any park unless the animal is restrained by a leash or lead any fecal material from the animal shall be cleaned up by the owner immediately p no person shall cast deposit throw damage lay place or scatter upon any of the stated public areas or in or upon any water located therein or adjacent thereto any cigars cigarettes glass bottles nails tacks wire crockery cans or any other refuse matter no person shall have in his possession any glass or other objects easily fragmented in or upon any water located within the park q no person shall possess consume or provide to others any alcoholic beverages in or upon any park playground or public ground without first obtaining a written permit therefor from the city council no person shall possess consume or otherwise provide to others any controlled substance in any park playground or public ground    2 4252011 violation  penalty a any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall be guilty of a petty misdemeanor b any person violating any of the provisions of this article may be expelled or ejected at such time from a park at the discretion of a law enforcement officer  article vi regulations for installation and use of antennas upon city property purpose definitions lease required application to enter into lease application fee lease agreement purpose the purpose of this article is to regulate the conditions under which private and noncity public antennas may be placed upon city property including water towers and other towers belonging to the city  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning antenna means that portion of any equipment located on the exterior or outside of any structure used for receiving andor transmitting radio television electromagnetic or other means of wireless transmission lease means that lease agreement outlined in section 50143 structure means any manmade building or device extending upward from the ground upon which may be constructed or affixed to an antenna  print preview  1122 lease required it shall be unlawful for any person or entity to construct or affix upon any city structure an antenna without first entering into a lease with the city duly dated and executed by the city and the lessee  application to enter into lease any person or entity desiring to enter into a lease with the city for the purpose of constructing or affixing an antenna to city property must first file with the city an application on a form supplied by the city which application shall contain but not be limited to the following information a name and address of the person or entity  if an entity a copy of the articles or other such document as will confirm its statutory organization b description of city structures desired to be leased c detailed description of the exact nature of the type or mode of wireless transmission to be utilized and the location from and to which any signals will be transmitted or received d list of any known means or modes of wireless transmission known to conflict with or otherwise cause interference with the applicants use e a schematic and mechanical diagram to scale showing all components of the antenna and other equipment to be placed within or upon the city structure f the hours of operation during which the antenna will be in use g the source of any power needed to operate the antenna and equipment h whether the applicant will be maintaining the antenna and equipment  if not the name and address of the person or entity doing the maintenance i the lighting or safety equipment required for said antenna under federal state andor local law regulation or ordinance j copies of each and every federal state or local permit or other approval aside from those of the city required for the construction maintenance andor use of said antenna k whether the applicant presently anticipates any increase in or change of the use of said antenna  application fee each application shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable fee in the sum of $50000 to permit the city to obtain an independent analysis of the feasibility compatibility and incompatibility of permitting the antenna requested  lease agreement  print preview  1222 lease agreement shall be in the following format city of north branch minnesota lease to under this agreement 2 premises lessor agrees to provide space for lessee on the property to accommodate an antenna to be mounted at ____________ feet agl on ____________________________________ with for itself and its successors and assigns not to construct or permit approve cause or otherwise allow to be constructed on the property or any other property located within a radius of 500 feet of the equipment on the premises in the event such interference shall occur lessor at its sole cost shall immediately take all steps as are necessary to correct and eliminate such interference including a legal description of property exhibit b description of antenna space and equipment space  article vii special events purpose definitions license required permit application requirements for issuance of license permit review permit conditions permit issuance indemnification agreement and liability insurance requirements insurance requirements revocation of permit violations purpose the following sections govern the time place and manner of holding certain special events on city streets on city property and on private property when an events impact upon the health fire law enforcement transportation or other services exceeds those regularly provided to that property this  print preview  1622 section is enacted in order to promote the health safety and welfare of the residents and visitors of the city by ensuring that special events do not create disturbances become nuisances menace or threaten life health and property disrupt traffic or threaten or damage private or public property it is not the intent of the city council by enacting this article to regulate in any manner the content of speech or infringe upon the right to assemble except for regulating the time place and manner of speech and assembly and this article should not be interpreted or construed otherwise  5232008 definitions for the purposes of this article the terms defined have the following meanings given to them applicant means any individual partnership corporation association society or group seeking andor receiving a special events license from the city license means a license issued by the city to allow a special event outdoor means activity conducted outside of a permanent structure or building person means any person association partnership firm business trust corporation or company special event means any temporary outdoor privately sponsored event open to the general public and held on public or privately owned property including but not limited to a concert parade fair show festival carnival rally party motorcade run street dance bikeathon race walk athletic event block party or other attended outdoor entertainment or celebration that is to be held in whole or in part upon publicly owned property or public rightofway or if held wholly upon private property will nevertheless affect or impact the ordinary and normal use by the general public of public property or public rightsofway within the vicinity of the event  5232008 license required any person or organization desiring to conduct or sponsor a special event in the city shall first obtain a special event license from the city a special event license is not required for the following types of events a any permanent place of worship stadium athletic field arena theatre auditorium or fairs conducted pursuant to minn stats ch 38 b special events or activities permitted or licensed by other state laws or regulations of the city of north branch including publicly sponsored activities in the local park system c family gatherings including family reunions graduation parties baptisms confirmations weddings funerals under 100 people d garage sales e nonrecurring auctions f events held in or on the grounds of any school place of worship athletic field arena auditorium or other place of assembly used for regularly established assembly purposes g an annual reoccurring event that has no change and at staff discretion  5232008  print preview  1722 permit application any person or organization desiring to sponsor a special event that is not exempted by this article must apply to the city for a special event permit this application must be filed not less than 45 days in advance of the date in which the event is to occur or at staff discretion special event permit applications must include the following information a type and description of the special event and a list of all activities to take place at the special event b the names and addresses of the persons responsible for conducting the event c proposed dates of the special event together with the beginning and ending times for each date d proposed location of the special event including a map of the proposed area to be used which shows any barricades street route plans or perimetersecurity fencing e estimated number of special event staff participants and spectators f whether the premises are owned by the applicant or if not owned the written permission from the owner or agent having authority to permit the use of such premises g any crowd control solid waste disposal parking and traffic control and insurance information required in section 50304 h whether food or alcohol is to be served or sold at the special event the licensee is responsible for obtaining all necessary food licenses from the state and county i signature of the applicant j if the event is an event planned within an area in which a street is to be closed the applicant must collect and submit with the application a list of signatures from all properties whose vehicular access to their properties will be affected consenting to the street closure k certificate of liability insurance covering the dates of the special event upon submission of an application for a special event license city staff will review the request and advise the applicant of the need for additional information if any  5232008 requirements for issuance of license a the following standards shall apply to all special events 1 maximum number of people the licensee shall not sell tickets nor permit attendance at the license location of more than the maximum number of people stated in the special event license 2 sound equipment sound producing equipment including but not limited to public address systems radios phonographs musical instruments and other recording devices shall not be operated on the premises of the special event so as to be unreasonably loud or be a nuisance or disturbance to the peace and tranquility of the citizens of north branch 3 sanitary facilities in accordance with minnesota state board of health regulations and standards local specifications adequate sanitary facilities must be provided which are sufficient to accommodate the projected number of persons expected to attend the event  print preview  1822 4 security the licensee shall employ at his own expense such security personnel as are necessary and sufficient to provide for the adequate security and protection of the maximum number of persons in attendance at the special event and for the preservation of order and protection of property in and around the event site security personnel shall generally be offduty licensed police officers no license shall be issued unless the citys chief of police is satisfied that such necessary and sufficient security personnel will be provided by the licensee for the duration of the event if deemed appropriate the chief of police may recommend that the council authorize alternate security personnel other than offduty officers 5 fire protection the licensee shall at his own expense take adequate steps to insure fire protection as determined by the citys fire chief 6 duration of special event the licensee shall operate the special event only on those days and during the hours specified on the license which shall not be for more than seven days 7 cleanup plan the licensee is responsible for clean up any extraordinary clean up required by the city will be charged to the licensee any city service that requires overtime will be at the expense of the applicant 8 waiver the city council may grant a waiver from the requirements of this article in any particular case where the applicant can show that strict compliance with this article would cause exceptional and undue hardship by reason of the nature of the special event or by reason of the fact that the circumstances make the requirement of this article unnecessary such waiver must be granted without detriment to the public health safety or welfare and without impairing the intent and purpose of these regulations 9 miscellaneous prior to issuance of a license the city council may impose any other conditions reasonably calculated to protect the health safety and welfare of persons attendant or of the citizens of the city of north branch  print preview  1922 b the following standards shall apply to special events with an expected attendance of over 100 persons or as city council recommends 1 crowd control a fence or barrier shall be constructed that completely encloses the proposed location and shall be of sufficient height and strength to prevent people in excess of the maximum permissible number from entering the event the fence or barrier shall have sufficient entrances and exits to allow easy movement into and out of the special event and provide traffic control onto established public road systems this requirement may be waived if the city council determines that a fence will not be necessary for crowd control 2 solid waste disposal a sanitary method of disposing of solid waste in compliance with state and local laws and regulations shall be provided and shall be sufficient to dispose of the solid waste production anticipated for the maximum number of people allowed by the license plans shall include a provision for holding and collecting all such waste at least once each day sufficient trash containers and sufficient personnel to perform such tasks 3 parking and traffic control a parking and traffic control plan for the number of persons projected to attend the event must be submitted such plan must be sufficient to ensure a free flow of traffic and make available rapid access for emergency vehicles further the applicant shall provide adequate offstreet parking facilities on the site or within 1500 feet thereof to accommodate the projected number of persons expected to attend the event 4 medical facilities medical or first aid facilities shall be provided which are sufficient to accommodate the projected number of persons to attend the event 5 lighting the licensee shall provide electrical illumination of all occupied areas sufficient to insure the safety and comfort of all attendees the licenses lighting plan shall be approved by city staff 6 potable water supply potable water meeting all federal and state requirement for sanitary quality and sufficient to provide drinking water for the maximum number of people allowed at the special event shall be provided  5232008 permit review the city council at any regular or special meeting may grant a license under this article upon due and proper application made therefore if in the judgment of the city council the application meets the standards of this article the city council may deny a license if in the judgment of the city council the granting of a license would adversely affect the safety health and welfare of the citizens of north branch the applicant shall be notified of such denial and may appear before the city council to appeal such denial criteria for denial of an application for a special event license may include but not be limited to a the information contained in the application or supplemental information requested from the applicant is false or nonexistent in any material detail b the applicant fails to supplement the application after having been notified by the city of additional information or documents needed c the applicant fails to agree to abide or comply with all of the conditions and terms of the special event permit  print preview  2022 d the time route hours location or size of the special event will unnecessarily disrupt the movement of other traffic within the area of the special event e the special event is of the size or nature that requires the diversion of too many law enforcement officers to properly police the event site and contiguous areas that allowing the special event would unreasonably deny law enforcement protection to the remainder of the city and its residents f another special event license has already been approved to hold another special event at the same time and place requested by the applicant or so close in time and place as to cause undue hardship undue traffic congestion or the city is unable to meet the needs to provide for law enforcement and other city services for both special events g the location of the special event would cause undue hardship for adjacent businesses or residents h the location of the special event will substantially interfere with any construction or maintenance work scheduled to take place upon or along public property or rightofway i the special event would endanger public safety or health j the special event would seriously inconvenience the general publics use of public property services or facilities k the applicant fails to comply with the liability insurance requirements or the applicants insurance lapses or is canceled l the special event would create or constitute a public nuisance m the special event would be likely to cause significant damage to public property or facilities  5232008 permit conditions the city council may condition the issuance of a license by imposing reasonable conditions concerning the time place and manner of the special event and such conditions are necessary to protect the safety of persons and property and the control of traffic  provided that such conditions shall not unreasonably restrict the right of free speech such conditions may include but are not limited to a alteration of the dates times route or location of the special event proposed b elimination of an activity at the special event which cannot be mitigated to a point as to ensure public safety and welfare or which causes undue liability to the city c requirements concerning the area of assembly and disbanding of a parade or other events occurring along a route d requirements concerning the accommodation of pedestrian or vehicular traffic including restricting the event to only a portion of the street rightofway e requirement for the use of traffic cones or barricades and shall be in accordance with the current minnesota manual on uniform traffic control devices mmutcd and any other requirements of the roadway authority that has jurisdiction over the affected street f requirements for the use of city personnel and equipment g requirements for the provision of first aid or sanitary facilities at the special event h compliance with animal protection ordinances and laws  print preview  2122 i requirements for the use of garbage containers and cleanup and restoration of any public property j restriction on the use of amplified sound and compliance with noise ordinances regulations and laws k requirements to provide notice of the special event to surrounding property owners l restrictions on the sale or consumption of food and alcohol  5232008 permit issuance the city clerk shall issue the special events permit once the application has been approved by the city council and the applicant has agreed to comply with the terms and conditions of the permit as well as the requirements of this article  5232008 indemnification agreement and liability insurance requirements all applicants must agree to indemnify and hold harmless the city of north branch and its employees against any and all losses claims damages or liability to which the organization participants or the city of north branch may become subject in connection with the conduct of any activity on the premises by the authorized organization organizations must agree to reimburse the city of north branch and its agents attorneys and employees in connection with defending any actions relating thereto all users of the facilities that are legally established within the state of minnesota are required to furnish a yearly certificate confirming liability insurance with the city named as an additional insured in the minimum amounts of $100000000 for bodily injury and property damage the city reserves the right to require adjusted insurance amounts and other applicants may be required to supply liability insurance as the city deems necessary  5232008 insurance requirements a liability insurance required the applicant or sponsor of the special event must possess or obtain liability insurance to protect against loss from liability imposed by law for damages on account of bodily injury or property damage arising from the special event a certificate of insurance must be filed with the city prior to issuance of the special events permit the certificate of insurance must name the city its officials employees and agents as additional insured insurance coverage must be maintained for the duration of the special event b minimum limits insurance coverage must be a commercial general liability policy the minimum limits must be at least $100000000 if alcoholic beverages are to be sold or distributed at the special event the policy must also include an endorsement for liquor liability the city council may require additional endorsements depending upon the type of special event and proposed activities  print preview  2222 c waiver or reduction of required limits the city council may waive or reduce the insurance requirements of this section under the following circumstances 1 the applicant or officer of the sponsoring organization signs a verified statement with documentation from a recognized insurance company that the insurance coverage requirements required by this section is impossible to obtain  or 2 the city council determines that the insurance requirements are in excess of the reasonable risk presented by the proposed special event  5232008 revocation of permit any permit issued pursuant to this section may be summarily revoked by the citys law enforcement officer at any time when by reason of disaster public calamity riot or other emergency the law enforcement officer determines that the safety of the public or property requires such revocation the city clerk may also summarily revoke any special event permit issued pursuant to this article if he or she finds that the permit has been issued based upon false information or when the permittee exceeds the scope of the permit notice of such action revoking the permit shall be delivered in writing to the permittee by personal service or certified mail at the address specified by the permittee in its application  5232008 violations a unlawful to sponsor a special event without a permit it is unlawful for any person to sponsor or conduct a special event requiring a permit pursuant to this article unless a valid special event permit has been issued for the event b unlawful to exceed the scope of the permit the special event permit authorizes the special event permittee or sponsor to conduct only such a special event as is described in the permit and in accordance with the terms and conditions of the permit it is unlawful for the permittee or sponsor to willfully violate the terms and conditions of the permit c misdemeanor any person convicted of violating this article shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be subject to a fine or imprisonment as specified by state statues each day in which a violation continues to occur shall constitute a separate offense violation of any provision of this article shall also be grounds for revocation of the special event permit  5232008  print preview  140 subdivisions article 54i in general article ii administration article iii preliminary plat final plat and minor subdivision data requirements article iv design standards article v public use dedication or contribution article vi required improvements article 54i in general title rules definitions policy purpose authority and scope jurisdiction compliance required approvals of subdivision plats interpretation and conflict exceptions enactment conveyance by metes and bounds public purpose exemptions lot split enforcement penalty for violation title this chapter shall officially be known cited and referred to as the subdivision ordinance of the city and will be referred to herein as this chapter  rules for the purpose of this chapter certain words used in this chapter are defined the term shall is mandatory the terms should and may are permissive terms used in the present tense shall include the future  and the singular number shall include the plural and the plural the singular in the event of conflicting provisions in the rest of these regulations the more restrictive shall apply  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning  print preview  240 alley means a public rightofway less than 50 feet in width which affords a secondary means of vehicular access to abutting property and which is not intended for general traffic circulation attorney means the attorney retained by the city unless otherwise stated block means an area of land within a subdivision which is entirely bounded by streets or by street railroad rightofway waterway or exterior boundary of the subdivision boulevard means the portion of the street rightofway between the curb line and the property line buildable land areapark dedication means that portion of property being subdivided that is not a wetland or in a flood plain as such terms are defined in section 668 of the north branch city means any structure used or intended for supporting or sheltering any use or occupancy building setback line means a line parallel to a street between which line and the nearest street rightofway line no building may be erected or placed city council means the city council of north branch cluster development means a conservation subdivision development planned and constructed so as to group housing units into patterns while providing a unified network of open space areas and meeting the overall density regulations of this chapter and the zoning chapter specifically conservation subdivision overlay district division of the zoning chapter comprehensive plan means the comprehensive plan prepared and adopted by the city or county indicating the general locations recommended for major land uses streets parks public buildings and other public improvements corner lot means a lot bordered on at least two sides by public or private streets county board means the governing body of chisago county crosswalk or pedestrian way means a publicly owned rightofway which crosses a block and furnishes pedestrian access to adjacent streets or properties design standards means specifications to landowners or subdividers for the preparation of plats both preliminary and final indicating among other things the optimum minimum or maximum dimensions of such items as rightofway blocks easements and lots development means the act of creating buildable lots and building structures as well as installing site improvements double frontage lots means lots which have a front line abutting on one street and a back or rear line abutting on another street drainage course means a water course or indenture for the drainage of surface water easement means a grant by a property owner to the use of a strip of land by the public a corporation or persons for specific purposes as the construction of utilities drainage ways and roadways engineer means the city or county engineer or a duly authorized consulting engineer  print preview  340 final plat means a map of all or a portion of a subdivision that is presented to the city council for final approval which if approved will be submitted to the county recorders office the plat must conform to these subdivision regulations and all appropriate state laws grade percentage of means the rise or fall of a street in feet and tenths of a foot for each 100 feet of horizontal distance measured at the centerline of the street growth management system means the goals policies programs ordinances and regulations used to guide the citys growth and development half street means any public rightofway having only onehalf the required rightofway width lot of record means a parcel of land whether it is subdivided has a separate tax identification number or is otherwise legally described as of the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived and recorded as such in the county recorders office or approved by the city as a lot subsequent to such date and which is occupied by or intended for occupancy by one principal building or principal use together with any accessory buildings or such open spaces as required by this chapter and having its principle frontage on a street or a proposed street approved by the city council lot depth means the horizontal distance between the street rightofway line and the opposite rear line of the lot measured in the general direction of the side lot lines lot width means the mean horizontal distance between the side property lines of a lot as measured at the building line metes and bounds description means any description of real property which is not described by reference to a lot or block shown on a map but is described by starting at a known point and describing the bearing and distances of the lines forming the boundaries of the property or delineates a fractional portion of a section lot or area by describing lines or portions thereof minor subdivision plat means the subdivision of a parcel into a small number of lots instead of by lot split or preliminaryfinal plat owner means persons partnerships firms associations corporations or combination thereof having proprietary interest in the land sought to be subdivided parks and playgrounds means public land and open spaces dedicated or reserved for recreational purposes pedestrian way means public or private rightofway across a block or within a block to provide access for pedestrians and which may be used for the installation of utility lines planned unit development means a tract of land planned and developed as a unit rather than an aggregate of houses on individual lots planning commission means the planning commission of the city having jurisdiction plat means a map or drawing indicating the subdivisions or resubdivision of land intended to be filed for record preliminary approval means the official action taken by a municipality on an application to create a subdivision which establishes the rights and obligations set forth in minn stats   and the applicable subdivision regulation in accordance with minn stats   and unless otherwise  print preview  440 specified in the applicable subdivision regulation preliminary approval may be granted only following the review and approval of a preliminary plat or other map or drawing establishing without limitation the number layout and location of streets utilities and facilities park and drainage facilities and lands to be dedicated for public use preliminary plat means the preliminary plat map drawing or chart indicating the proposed layout of the subdivision to be submitted to the planning agency and the city council for their consideration as to its compliance with the growth management goals policies and these regulations along with required supporting data private street means a street serving as vehicular access to one or more parcels of land which is not dedicated to the public but is owned by one or more private parties protective covenants means contracts made between private parties as to the manner in which land may be used with the view to protecting and preserving the physical and economic integrity of any given area rightofway means any land dedicated and publicly owned rural street section is a paved street with gravel shoulders and ditches or swales having a bituminous surface width of twentyeight feet with twofoot gravel shoulders sketch plan means a generalized plan of a proposed subdivision indicating lot layouts streets park areas and water and sewer systems presented to the city officials at a meeting prior to approval of the preliminary plat street means a public rightofway affording primary access by pedestrians and vehicles to abutting properties whether designated as a street highway thoroughfare parkway road avenue or boulevard street collector means a feeder street which carries traffic from local streets to arterials or provides connection primarily between arterial streets or arterial streets and minor streets collector streets include the principal entrance streets of a residential development and the principal streets for circulation within such development street culdesac means a short minor street with a turnaround and only one outlet street major or arterial means a street of considerable continuity with access restrictions designed to carry large volumes of between various sections in major traffic generation areas and beyond street marginal access means a minor street which is parallel and adjacent to a highway or an arterial street and which provides access to abutting properties and protection from street minor or local means a street which serves primarily as access to abutting properties and is not intended to carry street width means the street rightofway width measured at right angles to the centerline of the street subdivider means any individual firm association syndicate partnership corporation trust or legal entity having sufficient interest in the land sought to be subdivided to commence and maintain proceedings to subdivide the same under this chapter  print preview  540 subdivision means the division or combination of a lot tract or parcel for the purpose of transferring ownership or building development or if a new street is involved any division or development of a parcel of land the term shall include resubdivision of land tangent means a straight line that is perpendicular to the radius of a curve where it intersects a curve urban street section is a paved street with concrete curb and gutters and a width of 32 feet vertical curve means the surface curvature on a street centerline located between lines of different percentage of grade zoning ordinance means the ordinance section controlling the use of land as adopted by the city    2122007 history amended by on  policy a it is declared to be the policy of the municipality to consider the subdivision of land and the subsequent development of the subdivided plat as subject to the control of the municipality pursuant to the official comprehensive plan of the municipality for the orderly planned efficient and economical development of the municipality b land to be subdivided shall be of such character that it can be used safely for building purposes without danger to health or peril from fire flood or other menace and land shall not be subdivided until adequate public facilities and improvements exist and proper provision has been made for drainage water sewerage and capital improvements such as schools parks recreational facilities transportation facilities and improvements c the existing and proposed public improvements shall conform to and be properly related to the proposals shown on the comprehensive plan zoning map and the capital budget and program of the municipality and it is intended that these regulations shall supplement and facilitate the enforcement of the provisions and standards contained in the building and housing codes zoning ordinances the comprehensive plan the zoning map and land use plan and the capital budget and program of the municipality d land that has been subdivided prior to the effective date of the ordinance from which these regulations were derived should whenever possible be brought within the scope of these regulations to further the purposes of regulations identified in this section  purpose pursuant to the authority contained in minn stats   this chapter is adopted for the following purposes a to provide for the orderly economic and safe development of land and urban services and facilities in accordance with the comprehensive plan b to protect and promote the public health safety morals and general welfare of the residents of the city  print preview  640 c to assure equitable handling of all subdivision plats by providing uniform procedures d to improve records by establishing standards for surveys and plats e to protect the environmentally sensitive areas in the city areas and areas premature for urban development f to place the cost of improvements against those benefiting from their construction g to encourage the orderly and beneficial development of the community growth management techniques assuring the timing and sequencing of development promotion of development of undeveloped or underdeveloped areas in existing neighborhoods and nonresidential areas with adequate public facilities to assure adequate city services and road access open space separation of urban areas and to protect environmentally critical areas and areas premature for urban development h to provide for adequate light air and privacy to secure safety from fire flood and other danger and to prevent overcrowding of the land and undue congestion of population i to protect and conserve the value of land buildings and improvements throughout the municipality and to minimize the conflicts among the uses of land and buildings j to guide public and private policy and action in order to provide adequate and efficient transportation water sewerage parks schools recreation and other public requirements and facilities k to provide the most beneficial relationship between the uses of land and buildings and the circulation of traffic throughout the municipality having particular regard to the avoidance of congestion in the streets and highways and the pedestrian movements appropriate to the various uses of land and buildings and to provide for the proper location and width of streets and building lines l to establish reasonable standards of design and procedures for subdivisions and resubdivisions in order to further the orderly layout and use of land and to ensure proper legal descriptions and monumenting of subdivided land m to ensure that public facilities and services are available concurrent with development and will have sufficient capacity to serve the proposed subdivision and that the community will be required to bear no more than its fair share of the cost of providing the facilities and services the developer to pay fees furnish land or establish mitigation measures to ensure that the development provides its fair share of capital facilities needs generated by the development n to prevent the pollution of air streams and ponds  to assure the adequacy of drainage facilities  to safeguard the water table and to encourage the wise use and management of natural resources throughout the municipality in order to preserve the integrity stability and beauty of the community and the value of the land o to preserve the natural beauty and topography of the municipality and to ensure appropriate development with regard to these natural features p to provide for open spaces most efficient design and layout of the land including the use of average density in providing for minimum width and area of lots while preserving the density of the development as established in the zoning ordinance of the municipality q to ensure that the land is subdivided only when a subdivision is necessary to provide for uses of land for which market demand exists  print preview  740 r to remedy the problems associated with inappropriately subdivided lands including premature subdivision excess subdivision partial or incomplete subdivision and scattered and lowgrade subdivision  authority and scope the planning agency is vested with the authority to review and recommend approval conditional approval or disapproval of applications for the subdivision of land including sketch preliminary and final plats the city council is vested with the authority to review approve conditionally approve or disapprove applications for the subdivision of land including sketch preliminary and final plats the provisions of this chapter relate to any division of a tract of land into one or more parcels by platting replatting conveyance registered land survey or other means the city council may also grant variances from these regulations pursuant to the provisions in this chapter  history amended by on  jurisdiction a these regulations governing plats and the subdivision of land as defined in section 543 shall apply to the area within the corporate limits of the city or outside the corporate limits as provided by law b no land may be subdivided use of any legal description other than with reference to a plat approved by the planning agency and city council or by other means allowed by this chapter c the city council also shall have the authority to review and approve conditionally approve or disapprove the development of lands d no land described in this chapter shall be subdivided or developed until each of the following conditions has occurred in accordance with these regulations 1 the subdivider or his agent has submitted a conforming preliminary plat of the subdivision to the planning director for the planning agency and city council  2 the subdivider or his agent has obtained approval or conditional approval of the preliminary plat and final plat from the city council  and 3 the subdivider or his agent files the approved plats with the recorder for the county e no building permit or certificate of occupancy shall be issued for any parcel or plat of land created by subdivision after the effective date of and not in substantial conformity with the provisions of these subdivision regulations and no excavation of land or construction of any private or public improvements shall take place or be commenced except in conformity with these regulations  history amended by on  compliance  print preview  840 after the adoption of this chapter no lot in a subdivision shall be sold no permit shall be issued to alter or erect any building upon land in a subdivision and no building shall be erected in a subdivision unless a subdivision plat has been approved and recorded and until the improvements required by the city council relative to subdivision have been constructed or arranged for as provided in this chapter any subdivision creating parcels tracts or lots after the adoption of these regulations shall be platted except for lot splits as governed by this chapter  required approvals of subdivision plats before any plat shall have validity it shall have been approved by the planning agency and the city council and recorded in the county recorders office  history amended by on  interpretation and conflict in their interpretation and application the provisions of these regulations shall be held to the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety and general welfare it is not intended by this chapter to annul or interfere with any official regulations or ordinances of the city  provided however that when there is a difference between minimum standards or dimensions herein and those contained in other official regulations or ordinances of the city the highest and most restrictive standards shall apply these regulations are not intended to abrogate any easement covenant or any other private agreement or restriction provided that where the provisions of these regulations are more restrictive or impose higher standards or regulations than such private agreements the requirements of these regulations shall govern  exceptions a when requesting a subdivision if either of the two following conditions exist the planning director shall bring the request to the attention of the planning agency whereupon they shall receive the request and may recommend exemption of the subdivision from complying with any procedural requirements of this chapter deemed inappropriate for adequate review of subdivision requests 1 in any case in which compliance with section 5413 of this chapter will create an unnecessary hardship and failure to comply does not interfere with the intent of this chapter provided that such conveyance does not necessitate the dedication of a public rightofway and the newly created parcel will not cause the other remaining portion of the property to be in violation of this chapter or the zoning ordinance 2 where written justification is submitted by an applicant which clearly indicates that the intent of this chapter can be satisfied without enforcing all of the procedural requirements of this chapter b upon receiving the recommendation of the planning agency the city council by resolution may exempt the conveyance and the conveyance may then be filed or recorded  history amended by on   print preview  940 enactment in order that land may be subdivided in accordance with these purposes and policies these subdivision regulations are hereby adopted and made effective as of  all applications for subdivision approval including final plats pending the effective date of these regulations shall be reviewed under these regulations  that these regulations will not apply if preliminary plat approval was obtained prior to the effective date of these regulations unless the planning agency determines on the record that application of these regulations is necessary to avoid a substantial risk of injury to public health safety and general welfare  history amended by on  conveyance by metes and bounds no conveyance of one or more parcels in which the land is described by metes and bounds or by reference to an unapproved registered land survey made after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter shall be recorded if the parcels do not qualify for a lot split according to section 541534 and section 5416 unless such parcel was a separate parcel of record or was the subject of a written agreement to convey entered into prior to the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter  public purpose regulations of the subdivision of land and the attachment of reasonable conditions to land subdivision is an exercise of valid police power delegated by the state to this municipality the developer has the duty of compliance with reasonable conditions laid down by the planning agency for design dedication improvement and restrictive use of the land to conform to the physical and economic development of the municipality and to the health safety and general welfare of the future lot owners in the subdivision and of the community at large  history amended by on  exemptions the following conveyances shall be exempt from the provisions of this chapter and shall not constitute a subdivision a the parcel was a separate lot of record prior to the effective date of the section codified in this chapter b the parcel was the subject of a written agreement to convey entered into prior to the effective date of the section codified in this chapter c the parcel is split in two parts to create a second lot both parcels shall meet the minimum requirements set forth in the zoning ordinance and splitting the lot will not cause either proposed lot to be in violation of this chapter or the zoning chapter the lot split shall be allowed only when dedication of a public rightofway is not necessary only one lot split creating a new lot is allowed for each parcel a lot created by a lot split shall not be able to receive a lot split to create any additional new lots  print preview  1040 d the parcel is split in two parts  one part remains as a single lot which is buildable and meets the minimum requirements of the zoning ordinance and the second part will be attached to an existing abutting lot this lot split shall not cause the remaining portion of the original lot to be in violation of this chapter or the zoning ordinance the lot receiving the additional area shall not be eligible for a lot split to create another new lot unless it meets the minimum requirements set forth in the zoning ordinance including lot size to create a second lot prior to adding the additional area onto the parcel any lot split to create a new buildable lot must also follow the requirements set forth in the above subsection and section 5416  lot split a lot of record may be split as allowed by section 54153 4 as long as the criteria listed in this chapter and the zoning ordinance are met except that a lot split adding area to an existing abutting lot needs only to bring the lot receiving additional area further towards compliance with the minimum lot size lot depth lot width or road frontage if the lot being added to is not already in compliance with the minimum lot size width depth andor road frontage requirements a both the new lot and the remaining portion of the old lot meet the minimum lot size for the zoning district b both lots meet the minimum lot width for the zoning district c both lots have at least the minimum required public road frontage d the following information is provided to the city 1 legal description for the new parcel  2 legal description for the remaining separate parcel  3 survey of the new parcel e the lot split may require dedication of easements as required by the city f the lot split certificate must be recorded with the county g will not be receiving urban services shall meet the buildable standards as stated in city section 75 general requirements  history amended by on  enforcement unless approved as a final plat as provided in this chapter no subdivision shall be entitled to record in the county recorders office or have validity  and the building official shall not issue building permits for any structure on a lot in any proposed subdivision the city shall not permit any public improvements to be installed unless the final plat is approved and recorded  penalty for violation any person who violates any of the provisions of these regulations or who sells leases or offers for sale or lease any lot block or tract of land regulated before all the requirements of this chapter have been complied with shall be punished as provided in section 111  print preview  1140  article ii administration division 54ii1 generally division 2 procedure for subdivision review division 3 preliminary plats division 4 final plat division 5 variance and amendments division 6 fees division 54ii1 generally division 2 procedure for subdivision review sketch plan sketch plan a at the subdividers option the developer may submit a sketch plan for development that the planning agency city council and city staff review b before preparing the sketch plan for a subdivision the applicant shall schedule an appointment and meet with the planning director to discuss the procedure for approval of a subdivision plat and the requirements as to general layout of streets and for reservations of land street improvements drainage sewerage fire protection and similar matters as well as the availability of existing services including schools the planning director shall also advise the applicant when appropriate to discuss the proposed subdivision with those officials who must eventually approve those aspects of the subdivision plat coming within their jurisdiction c approval of the sketch plan is not binding any ordinances changed after the sketch plan shall be reflected in the preliminary and final plats  history amended by on  division 3 preliminary plats applicability application public final plat requirements as the minor subdivision is a hybrid of those requirements a subdivider may elect to apply for a minor subdivision instead of a preliminary plat provided the following conditions are met if the subdivision does not meet these conditions the full preliminary and final plat processes shall be followed 1 the minor subdivision shall not result in the creation of more than four lots 2 the minor subdivision shall not require the creation of any new public road rightofway the minor subdvision shall be served by existing public roads a application a preliminary plat application procedure a request for subdivision as provided within this chapter shall be filed with the planning director on an official application form such application shall be accompanied by a fee as outlined in division six of this chapter this fee shall not be refundable such application shall also be accompanied by 18 fullsized copies of the preliminary plat and two reducedsized copies of the preliminary plat the preliminary plat must substantially comply in all respects with the sketch plan if one was submitted unless otherwise directed by the planning agency city council or city staff the applicant shall also supply a listing of the property owner and all property of record within 350 feet of the perimeter of the property in question and a graphic of the 100 feet surrounding the property and the owners for each lot the preliminary plat application and appropriate fees as well as any other information required shall be submitted at least 15 days before the next regular meeting and in accordance with the deadline set by the planning director applications are not considered complete and cannot be processed until all data required by the city has been submitted the planning director shall refer the application and preliminary plat to the planning agency for consideration b minor subdivision application procedure a request for subdivision as provided within this chapter shall be filed with the planning director on an official application form such application shall be accompanied by a fee as outlined in division six of this chapter this fee shall not be refundable such application shall also be accompanied by 20 reducedsized 11 x 17 copies of the plat the minor subdivision plat must substantially comply in all respects with the sketch plan if one was submitted unless otherwise directed by the planning agency city council or city staff the applicant shall also supply a listing of the property owners and all property of record within 350 feet of the perimeter of the property in question and a graphic of the 100 feet surrounding the property and the owners for each lot the minor subdivision plat application and appropriate fees as well as any other information required shall be submitted at least 15 days before the next regular planning agency meeting and in accordance with the deadline set by the planning director applications are not considered complete and cannot be processed until all data required by the city has been submitted the planning director shall refer the application and minor subdivision plat to the planning agency for consideration b history amended by on  public hearing date a the planning director at the direction of the planning agency shall set a date for a public hearing to be conducted by the planning commission notice of such hearing shall be published in the  print preview  1340 official newspaper of the municipality at least ten days prior to the date of the hearing such notice shall also be mailed not less than ten days to 1 all property owners of record according to the county assessment records within 350 feet of the property  2 the commissioner of the state department of natural resources if the proposed subdivision is located in part or in total within the s shoreland or fp floodplain zoning district  3 the commissioner of the state department of transportation and the county engineer if the proposed plat abuts or includes a state trunk highway or a county state aid road respectively b a copy of the notice and a list of the individuals andor property owners and addresses to which the notices were sent shall be attested to by the planning director and made part of official record the failure to give mailed notice to individual property owners or defects in the notice shall not invalidate the proceedings provided a bona fide attempt to comply with this subsection has been made c history amended by on  considering a public hearing on preliminary plat or subdivision the planning commission shall consider the preliminary plat or minor subdivision and hold a public hearing at the next regular meeting unless the filing date falls within 15 days of the meeting in which case the preliminary platminor subdivision would be placed on the agenda and considered at the regular meeting following the next regular meeting the planning director shall refer the application along with all related information to the planning agency for consideration the applicant or a representative thereof shall appear before the planning commission in order to answer questions concerning the preliminary platminor subdivision d history amended by on  considering factors for the preliminary plat or subdivision in considering the preliminary plat or minor subdivision system or other development plans  c consistency with the zoning chapter  d the physical characteristics of the site including but not limited to topography erosion and flooding potential and soil limitations are suitable for the type of development or use contemplated  e the proposed development will not create a negative fiscal or environmental impact upon the city e  print preview  1440
