standards specified below a one temporary manufactured home for the property owners to occupy when rebuilding their primary residence after a fire flood tornado wind damage or other destructive event or for the parents grandparents or children of the property owners subject to 1 the manufactured home would be located on a parcel of at least onehalf acre 21780 square feet of buildable land with one permanent dwelling the occupants of either the manufactured home or the permanent dwelling must be a the parentss or grandparents of the occupant of the other residence on the property  or b a child sister brother or grandchild who has full or total disability as classified by social security workers compensation or a doctor and who resides in or will reside in one of the residences 2 the applicant shall submit with the initial application and annually thereafter a signed statement certifying that the occupants of the manufactured home is a parent grandparent child sister or brother who suffers a full or total disability as classified by social security workers compensation or a doctor the statement shall describe the need that makes it necessary for parents grandparents or relative of the first degree to live on the same parcel with the children or children or a release that will allow the city administrator or hisher designee to verify the disability 3 the owner shall remove the manufactured home from the site within 120 days of such time as it or the permanent residence ceases to be occupied by a parent grandparent grandchild child sister or brother 4 the owner shall not make the manufactured home a permanent residence 5 the manufactured home shall not require the creation of a separate well  print preview  82215 6 an onsite sewage treatment system to serve the manufactured home can be installed on the property in accordance to all city and state standards or if possible the owners may attach the sewage system for the manufactured home to an existing onsite sewage system if the existing system has enough capacity for additional users 7 the placement of the proposed manufactured home must meet all setback standards and shall not cause drainage or stormwater runoff problems for adjacent properties 8 the owner shall not place the manufactured home in a front yard 9 the owner submitting to the city an escrow issued in the name of the city and payable to the city for the sum of $500000 that the city may draw down at its sole discretion for the purposes including but not limited to the cost of capping and closing of any separate onsite sewage treatment systems or wells site restoration administrative and legal fees and the repayment of delinquent personal property taxes on the manufactured home the city shall hold the escrow for as long as the manufactured home is on the property and shall return the escrow within 90 days of the completion of all necessary site restoration  7142014 conditional uses the following are conditional design standards 1 minimum ground floor area shall be 800 square feet for a single story dwelling a dwelling unit with one and a half or more stories shall have a minimum of 800 square feet on main floor 2 permanent full perimeter footings  with foundation walls of concrete concrete block wood or any other approved material or method decks and porches are allowed on pier type footings 3 minimum width 24 feet 4 a minimum roof pitch of 412 4 vertical rise for each 12 horizontal run 5 provisions for decks must be shown on original plans when a sliding glass door patio door etc are installed 6 and 40 acres animals may be kept at the rate of one animal for every two acres pens roosts barns and other holding areas are considered accessory buildings and must setback at least 75 feet from the side andor rear lot lines d for lots between five and ten acres animals may be kept at the rate of one animal for every one accessible acre to qualify as an accessible acre the area must be fenced or purpose the purpose of the rr rural residential district is a to prevent scattered nonfarm uses from developing improperly b to allow suitable areas of the city to be retained and utilized in open space andor agricultural uses c to promote orderly development and secure economy in government expenditures for public utilities and service  permitted uses the following are permitted uses in the rr yard area and building size requirements purpose the purpose of this section is to identify subdivisions approved under an old ordinance and the approved setbacks for those subdivisions all uses design standards fencing screening landscaping and parking requirements shall be the same as the underlying zoning district the following subdivisions were approved under these regulations chain lake preserve chain lake preserve first addition chain lake preserve 2nd addition country view estates plat 6 eagles nest preserve edgewater commons northern preserve sunny meadows and tall timbers  yard area and building size requirements a yard area and building size requirements in the cs conservation subdivision district shall be as follows 1 lot area minimum of ten acres in unsewered areas except for lots in conservation subdivisions approved prior to  where the minimum lot area is 15000 sq feet 2 lot width at front yard setback line minimum of 100 feet 3 minimum lot depth 150 feet 4 yard dimensions a front yard setback 30 feet from the lot line or road rightofway if applicable b side yard setback each side minimum of ten feet from the interior lot line c corner side yard setback minimum of 30 feet from lot line or road rightofway if applicable d rear yard setback for interior lots minimum of 30 feet from the lot line e rear yard setback for corner lots 15 feet from the lot line 5 maximum building height 35 feet  print preview  99215 6 maximum impervious area 50 percent 7 wetland setback a a 20foot natural buffer shall be maintained adjacent to all wetlands on lots created after the adoption of this chapter b a minimum 40foot setback is required for all structures adjacent to all wetlands on lots created after the adoption of this chapter 8 floor elevation a the lowest floor elevation for new or redevelopment will be three feet above the highest known groundwater level b the lowest floor elevation for new or redevelopment will be two feet above the 100year flood elevation b designated open space must be restricted from further development to retain or protect natural scenic or openspace areas and assure its availability for agricultural forest recreational or openspace use  protect natural resources maintain or enhance air and water quality preserve the historical architectural archeological or cultural aspects of property c if the conservation subdivision in the future becomes located in the north branch urban services area nbusa and water and sewer utilities are extended to the conservation subdivision the fee holder may develop the open space under the applicable north branch guidelines if the developments homeowners association upon a vote of its members elects to develop the open space d recreational uses are prohibited above or within 50 feet of communal drainfields e no new lots may be created within these existing conservation subdivisions unless municipal utilities are available    892010 division 11 the purpose of the cbd commercial business district is a to provide for high intensity commercial activity within a compact central area stressing the pedestrian function and interaction of people and businesses  and b to provide a local retail service and civic center for the community   print preview  100215 permitted uses the following are permitted uses in the cbd commercial business district 1 reasonably practicable  9 the interim use permit will be issued in the name of the person requesting the permit and will be for the purpose of selling a particular item or range of items at a specific television broadcasting d dry cleaning facilities e contractors yardshop  print preview  118215 f meat market and meat processing business or facility including slaughtering where the owner or operator meets the following requirements 1 all animalrelated and business activities shall be conducted indoors no outdoor storage including animals or trailers is allowed 2 the city may allow meat processing facilities by conditional use permit only as an accessory use to a meat market the meat processing facility shall be located in the same building as a meat market and the floor area of the meat processing facility shall not exceed the floor area of the meat market the conditional use permit will limit the size of the facility and the number of animals for keeping or slaughtering 3 the applicant shall submit to the city a plan showing all staging areas for the temporary storage of carcasses and disposal of animal remains 4 the owner or operator shall conduct all uses and activities in strict conformance with all federal and state laws for the operation of such facilities 5 the owner or operator shall conduct the slaughtering of animals inside a closed building in a confined area to prevent the transmission of sound associated with the slaughter to the outside 6 the owner or operator shall dispose of all waste in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations this includes but is not limited to all sewage processed and unprocessed animal parts manure entrails blood hides and bones at a minimum the owner or operator shall dispose of waste within 48 hours of being produced shall store all waste in airtight containers and shall keep all waste in fully enclosed structures the owner or operator shall remove from the site on a daily basis the manure from the holding areas 7 the owner or operator of the facility shall have all necessary federal state and county licenses and approvals and shall meet or exceed all state and federal health and safety regulations and standards 8 the hours of operation for the facility shall be subject to approval by the city council as part of the conditional use permit 9 the owner or operator shall not hold live animals onsite for more than 24 hours 10 the owner or operator shall screen all loading and unloading areas from view from adjacent properties and public streets g radio and television transmitting station h cellular telecommunication and digital and telephone towers or antennas i outdoor storage shall be a conditional use permit paving and screening of this storage area shall be addressed as part of the conditional use permit expansion of existing outdoor storage areas shall require a conditional use permit j recreational or sports facilities k industrial planned unit developments as regulated in section 66788 et seq l auction houses that have outside sales display or storage m similar conditional uses as determined by the city     10242005   3122007   892010   3242014  print shall apply to all developments in the i3 planned industrial district  required parking for permitted uses four parking spaces per 1000 square feet of gross floor area of all principal and accessory structures shall be provided and maintained unless otherwise regulated in section 66848 et seq  print preview  124215  performance standards all uses allowed in the i3 planned industrial district shall comply with all applicable federal state and local nuisance and pollution laws ordinances and regulations  design standards all structures in this zoning district must meet the city design guidelines and be approved by the city design committee    892010 screening a all outside storage requires a conditional use permit and in addition to any other conditions imposed by the governing authority must be screened b all screening shall have gates or other means of blocking vision points gates shall match screening and be properly maintained c all vehicles in excess of threequarter ton capacity or equipment shall be screened with an eight foot high fence of 90 percent opacity storage shall not be allowed in trucks trailers or similar containers  paved surface all vehicular driving and parking areas shall be paved and be surrounded with pouredinplace concrete curb and gutter except in special circumstances such as offroad heavy equipment storage areas or contractor nonretail material storage areas with approval by the planning commission  waste a all solid waste materials debris refuse or garbage shall be kept within a completely enclosed building or properly contained in closed containers and stored in racks designed for such purposes all liquid wastes containing any organic or toxic matter shall be discharged in a manner prescribed by the governing authority b all waste shall be placed in containers or enclosures in a manner not constituting a nuisance by reason of windlitter disorderly appearance or abnormal fire hazard c all waste containers or racking not in an enclosed building shall be completely screened for its full height but not less than eight feet d no outside incinerators or trash burners shall be installed erected or utilized on any lot  nonpermitted buildings and temporary buildings a no trailer basement tent shack garage barn or other outbuilding shall at any time be used for  print preview  125215 human habitation temporarily or permanently  nor shall any structure of temporary character be maintained upon a building site except as temporarily incidental to building construction b temporary construction trailers used in conjunction with a building project are not considered temporary buildings and therefore are permitted during construction c no temporary buildings and structures for any purpose shall be erected on the site without written approval from the city d temporary structures will only be approved for extenuating circumstances one year after construction begins all temporary buildings and their supporting systems shall be removed from the site and the original site improvements returned to their original condition  maintenance of vacant tracts all owners of vacant lots or tracts shall keep them clean mowed and maintained in a manner that will not depreciate other property value  reserved editors note   adopted  repealed  66669 which pertained to minimum development value and derived from   of the 1996 i4 industrial district purpose permitted uses accessory uses conditional uses area and bulk regulations screening and landscaping requirements required parking performance standards design standards purpose the purpose of the i4 industrial district is to establish and preserve areas for industrial development including manufacturing fabrication packaging assembly warehouse and distribution as well as related uses of such a nature that they do not create serious problems of compatibility with other kinds of land uses  3102008 permitted uses the following are permitted uses within the i4 industrial district a manufacturing operations except that the city prohibits all asphalt plants and asphalt manufacturing b fabrication operations c assembly operations d warehouse operations  print preview  126215 e distribution operations f showrooms g researchdevelopment facilities h laboratories i wholesale trade operations j printing plants facilities and publishing establishments k indoor recreation or athleticfitness facilities l buildings containing offices for professional and other service industries as well as headquarters for businesses and corporations m transfer facilities n truck or transportationmotor freight terminal o auction or sales houses where all sales display and storage are indoors p uses similar to the above permitted uses as determined by the city q brew pub and brew tap room  3102008   10282013   3242014 history amended by on  accessory uses the following are permitted accessory uses in the i4 industrial district a commercial or screening and landscaping as permitted and regulated by section 66970 et seq e signs as regulated by section 66821 et seq f essential services g essential service buildings of 1000 square feet or less set forth in and regulated by section 6662 et seq a multiple principal buildings on a lot of record b antenna for radio or television broadcasting c radio and television transmitting station  print preview  127215 d cellular telecommunication and digital telephone towers or antennas e outdoor storage shall be a conditional use permit the screening for the outdoor storage area shall be an opaque wall constructed of the same or similar materials as the building or of a design and materials approved by the city council materials stored outdoors shall not exceed the height of the screening wall the city may require and annual review of the conditional use permit to assure compliance with the city conditions f industrial planned unit developments as regulated in section 66655 et seq g hotels
